entry.title: The Latest: French premier says Greek reform plan 'complete'
entry.summary:
Tsipras will seek backing for a harsh new austerity package from his party Friday to keep his country in the euro - less than a week after urging Greeks to reject milder cuts in a referendum.

Valls warned of the economic as well as political risks of a Greek exit from the euro.

Greece met a Thursday deadline with a sweeping reform package that it hopes will convince creditors to turn lend it billions more, which would secure the country's place in the 19-country eurozone.

entry.title: The Latest: Euro summit may not occur if Greek deal emerges
entry.summary: Hopes have grown that Greece can secure a rescue deal at a meeting of European Union leaders on Sunday in Brussels that would prevent the country's exit from the euro.

entry.title: Greece rushes to finalize reforms and remain in euro
entry.summary:
Meanwhile, many ATMs had a shortage of 20 euro notes, effectively reducing the daily withdrawal limit to 50 euros.

After months of fruitless negotiations with Tsipras' government, elected in January on promises to repeal bailout austerity, the skeptical eurozone creditor states have said they want to see a detailed, cost-accounted plan of the reforms.

entry.title: Greece rushes to finalize reforms and remain in euro
entry.summary: He said in a speech it was up to eurozone governments and Greek leaders themselves to rescue Greece.

entry.title: Big Euro teams to avoid small World Cup qualifying groups
Big Euro teams to avoid small World Cup qualifying groups
entry.summary: Romania and Wales entered the top 10 on FIFA's rankings on Thursday after going unbeaten to lead their Euro 2016 qualifying groups.

entry.title: Greece rushing to finalize reforms and remain in euro
entry.summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary Jack Lew added pressure on the European lenders, arguing debt relief was needed for a deal - and describing a Greek euro-exit as a "geopolitical mistake.

entry.title: Greece rushing to finalize reforms and remain in euro
entry.summary: Failure to reach a deal could be the first step toward Greece leaving the shared euro currency.

entry.title: Greece rushing to finalize reforms and remain in euro
entry.summary: If Tsipras does not get a deal, Greece faces an almost inevitable collapse of the banking system, which would be the first step for the country to fall out of the euro.

entry.title: Euro zone gives Greece until Sunday for debt deal
entry.summary: Euro zone members have given Greece until the end of the week to come up with a proposal for sweeping reforms in return for loans that will keep the country from crashing out of Europe's currency bloc and into economic ruin.

entry.title: The Latest: Dutch: Greece needs quick solution to save euro
entry.summary:
German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble says Berlin still opposes an actual debt cut for Greece as he arrived at a meeting with his counterparts in the 19-country eurozone.

Arriving for talks with his peers in the 19-country eurozone, Dijsselbloem said the Greek government has "a major interest" in bringing forward "serious and credible" proposals that are needed if Greece is to get another bailout.

entry.title: Greece faces last chance to stay in euro as cash runs out
entry.summary:
He did not name names but may have been referring to German finance minister Wolfgang Schaeuble, who has made no secret of his scepticism about Greece's fitness to stay in the euro and last week suggested a possible "temporary" exit.

Tsakalotos entered the euro zone finance ministers' meeting without comment.

The United States, China and Japan all called for a solution in which Greece stays in the euro zone.

entry.title: Greece faces last chance to stay in euro as cash runs out
entry.summary: At stake at the emergency summit beginning at 6 p.m. in Brussels is more than just the future of Greece, a nation of 11 million that makes up just 2 percent of the euro zone's economic output and population.

entry.title: The Latest: France pledges effort to keep Greece in euro
entry.summary: French Prime Minister Manuel Valls says his country will do everything possible to keep Greece in the eurozone, saying its exit would be a "risk for global economic growth."

entry.title: Asia shares wilt as China tanks, euro awaits Greece summit
entry.summary: Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras told German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Monday that he would bring a proposal for a deal to Tuesday's emergency euro zone summit, a Greek official said.

entry.title: What's next as Greece stumbles toward euro exit
entry.summary: Greece, which overspent for years until its troubles became clear in 2009, has already been granted 240 billion euros in loans from the other eurozone countries.

entry.title: Eurozone leaders to hold emergency summit on Greece
entry.summary:
"It is now up to the government of Alexis Tsipras to make serious, credible proposals so that this willingness to stay in the eurozone can translate into a lasting programme," Hollande said.

"And that is why we are now waiting for very precise proposals from the Greek prime minister, a programme that will allow Greece to return to prosperity," said Merkel, adding that eurozone countries had already shown "a lot of solidarity with Greece".

entry.title: What's next, as Greece stumbles toward euro exit
entry.summary: That's followed by a meeting of eurozone finance ministers on Tuesday, and a full summit of the leaders of the 19 euro countries that evening.

entry.title: What's next, as Greece stumbles toward euro exit
entry.summary:
Next stop could be the badlands of euro exit.

Many analysts think that would result in Greece leaving the euro.

entry.title: Eurozone leaders set weekend deadline for Greece
entry.summary: "When Greece, Europe, the eurozone is at stake, we have to know how to finish negotiations," French President Francois Hollande said.

entry.title: Yes or no? Greeks vote on high-stakes bailout referendum
entry.summary: Polls published Friday showed the two sides in a dead heat and that an overwhelming majority of people questioned - about 75 percent - wanted Greece to remain in the euro currency.

entry.title: Greece votes in referendum with future in euro in doubt
entry.summary:
His European partners, however, say rejection would set Greece on a path out of the euro, with potentially far-reaching consequences for the global economy and Europe's grand project of an unbreakable union.

"If they (Greeks) say 'No', they will have to introduce another currency after the referendum because the euro is not available as a means of payment," Martin Schulz, the president of the European Parliament, said in remarks broadcast on Germany's Deutschlandfunk radio on Sunday.

entry.title: Greece votes on high-stakes bailout referendum
entry.summary:
The opposition accuses Tsipras of jeopardizing the country's membership in the eurozone and says a "yes" vote is about keeping the common currency.

"I am voting 'yes' because I believe that my future and even my kids' future, in twenty or thirty years from now, is in the eurozone and the European Union," Spiliotopoulos said on the eve of the referendum.

entry.title: Greece votes on high-stakes bailout referendum
entry.summary:
They also showed an overwhelming majority of people - about 75 percent - want Greece to remain in the euro currency.

He said if the European Union wants to keep Greece in the eurozone, it will have to come up with "a very generous plan" since the cost of the crisis has shot up to unanticipated levels.

entry.title: Would euro departure help or hurt Europe's currency union?
entry.summary:
Here is a look at some of the possible damage - and any benefits - of a Greek-euro divorce.

But that might prove more difficult if Greece was no longer a part of the euro - and did not face external pressure from fellow eurozone states to modernize its economy.

entry.title: Would euro departure help or hurt Europe's currency union?
entry.summary:
Ironically, a few experts think one of the most devastating outcomes for the euro would be if Greece leaves and, against all expectation, thrives.

That would undermine claims for the euro being a key to prosperity.

For the long term, a Greek exit would disrupt the euro's "Hotel California" principle: that, as the Eagles put it, you can "check out any time you like, but you can never leave."

A number of economists, however, think a Greek exit could cause long-lasting damage to the euro.

entry.title: Greek PM Tsipras says Sunday's referendum is not a vote on whether to remain in the euro
The Latest: France's Sapin says committed to Greece in euro
entry.summary:
French Finance Minister Michel Sapin says Europe remains committed to avoiding "catastrophe" for Greece and keeping it in the eurozone.

Sapin said on France's iTele television Thursday that "the exit of Greece from the eurozone is not desirable, nor envisaged."

entry.title: The Latest: France's Sapin says committed to Greece in euro
The euro is only headed down: Goldman
entry.summary:
"We continue to see mounting tensions over Greece as a catalyst for the euro-dollar to go near parity, if contagion to other peripherals causes the European Central Bank (ECB) to accelerate quantitative easing."

But the bank noted: "We fail to see how mounting tensions around Greece do anything other than reinforce U.S. outperformance over the euro zone, i.e., we see this price action as a fade."

"The Italian sovereign spread tended to lead the euro. The European common currency, that is, rose along with European bond yields and vice versa. That's the opposite of what one would expect in the case of contagion," he said.

entry.title: Greek official: eurozone finance ministers' teleconference over, will continue Wed morning
Falling energy prices prompt modest fall in eurozone inflation to 0.2 percent in May
entry.summary: Earlier this year, when prices were falling, there were fears the eurozone was set for a potentially debilitating period of deflation - falling prices can weigh on economic activity by making consumers postpone purchases.

entry.title: Chinese premier wants Greece to stay in eurozone for 'world financial stability'
entry.summary: "That is why China wants to see Greece stay in the euro, stay in the eurozone, and we urge relevant creditors to reach an agreement with the Greek government at an early time," the Chinese premier said.

entry.title: Asia stocks fall, euro drifts down as Greek crisis deepens
entry.summary: Last-ditch talks by euro zone finance ministers will resume on Saturday to either avert a Greek default next week or start preparing for a "Plan B" to protect the euro zone from financial market turmoil.

entry.title: Eurozone leaders set weekend deadline for Greece
entry.summary: A default on its debts could eventually force Greece out of the eurozone, which would be hugely painful for the country.

entry.title: Eurozone leaders set weekend deadline for Greece
entry.summary: European leaders have tasked finance ministers from the euro countries with concluding a debt financing agreement with Greece over the weekend, just days before Athens has to meet a crucial debt deadline.

entry.title: Finland sack coach Mixu Paatelainen as former striker pays the price for four straight losses in Euro 2016 qualifiers
entry.summary: Finland have sacked coach Mixu Paatelainen following a fourth straight defeat in their Euro 2016 qualifying campaign, the Football Association of Finland (SPL) said on Sunday.

entry.title: THE LATEST: Greeks march to show support for staying in euro
entry.summary:
Jeroen Dijsselbloem, the Dutchman who chairs the eurozone finance ministers' meetings, said negotiators would be using Greek proposals made this weekend as a basis for further talks.

After a midday meeting among the 19 eurozone ministers, Finnish Finance Minister Alexander Stubb said "No agreement. We agreed to continue" negotiations to look for a full deal later in the week.

entry.title: THE LATEST: Greeks march to show support for staying in euro
entry.summary:
"It's an opportunity to get that deal this week," he said after the eurozone meeting on Monday ended.

Schaeuble said Monday ahead of a finance ministers' meeting on the issue: "We are still in the same situation as last Thursday," when the 19 ministers of the eurozone last assessed Greece's proposals.

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
entry.summary: A flag which says "stop" and has euro money signs in the EU stars flaps in the wind during a protest march in solidarity with Greece in the center of Brussels on Sunday, June 21, 2015.

entry.title: European Leaders Working Hard to Keep Greece in Eurozone
entry.summary: Greece is facing a June 30 deadline to make a 1.6 billion euro ($1.8 billion) loan repayment to the International Monetary Fund, which, at present, it would be unable to make, and even bigger payments to the ECB in July.

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
entry.summary: Hollande said that "if the Greeks leave the eurozone it won't be positive for the Greeks or Europeans."

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
entry.summary: Later Hollande told reporters in Milan, where he met with Italian Premier Matteo Renzi, that everything must be done to keep financially-ailing Greece in the Eurozone.

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
French leftists rally in support of Greece
entry.summary: Greece's new radical leftist government is in a stand-off with international creditors to reach a loan deal to avoid defaulting on debt payments at the end of the month, threatening an exit from the 19-nation eurozone.

entry.title: French leftists rally in support of Greece ahead of Monday eurozone summit
entry.summary: PARIS - Several thousand leftists have rallied in Paris to "give Greece a chance" two days ahead of a critical summit of eurozone leaders on a bailout.

entry.title: Greek premier Tsipras, ministers discuss strategy, proposals for next week's Eurozone summit
entry.summary: ATHENS, Greece - Two days before a crucial summit of Eurozone leaders, Greek ministers are huddling to discuss strategy and assemble a new package of proposals, officials say.

entry.title: Asian stock markets slip, euro slides as Greek debt talks appear to go nowhere
Asia Stocks Slip, Euro Down as Greek Debt Talks Falter
entry.summary: Asian stocks slipped and the euro sank Monday as Greece inched closer to a possible default after weekend talks with international creditors over freeing up the rest of its bailout funds went nowhere.

entry.title: Asia stocks slip, euro down as Greek debt talks falter
entry.summary: CURRENCIES: The euro faltered on news of the Greek debt impasse, falling nearly 0.5 percent to $1.1207 from $1.1260 in late trading Friday.

entry.title: Euro slips, mood darkens as Greece fails to reach deal
entry.summary: The euro skidded 0.4 percent on the day to $1.1215 EUR=, and was down 0.5 percent against the yen at 138.28 EURJPY=.

entry.title: Faeroe Islands beat Greece again in Euro 2016 qualifying
Northern Ireland vs Romania match report: Michael O'Neill's men stay in hunt for Euro 2016 finals
entry.summary: Kyle Lafferty and Oliver Norwood were denied in a tense finale as Northern Ireland's crunch Euro 2016 qualifier against Romania ended in stalemate at Windsor Park.

entry.title: Interpol suspends 20 million euro partnership with Fifa
Belgium finds way to issue its own Waterloo euro coin
Belgium finds way to issue its own Waterloo euro coin
entry.summary: This week, Belgium decided to circumvent French resistance by invoking a little-known European Union rule that allows countries to issue euro coins of their choice, provided they are in an irregular denomination.
